{"step_by_step_thinking": "Autosomal dominant hypercholesterolemia type II is also known as Familial Hypercholesterolemia. According to Document [3], mutations in the LDL receptor (LDLR) cause 80% to 90% of cases of clinical FH and have an autosomal dominant inheritance. This suggests that the deficiency of LDL receptor is the primary cause of this type of hypercholesterolemia.", "answer_choice": "A"}
